global.title: The Orchid's Gambit
global.logline: A courtesan wagers her freedom on a game of Go, using every weapon in her arsenal to win her chance at true love with the florist she has watched from afar.
global.lighting: Warm amber candlelight dominates interior scenes, creating intimate pools of gold against deep shadows. Natural daylight filters through rice paper screens during day scenes, soft and diffused. The flower shop glows with humble lantern light. Night exteriors balance cool blue moonlight with warm window glow. Strong contrast between the opulent warmth of the brothel and the simple honest light of Lin's world.
global.color_palette: Rich jewel tones in the brothel: deep crimsons, burgundy, gold thread, dark mahogany woods. Mei's signature powder blue kimono stands out against these warm tones. Lin's world uses earthen colors: terracotta, green foliage, weathered wood, natural undyed fabrics. White and purple orchids serve as a visual bridge between both worlds. The Go board's black and white stones echo the binary nature of Mei's gamble.
global.vibe: Sensual tension layered with desperate hope. The aesthetic of restrained longing—beauty observed but untouched. Classical Chinese elegance meets raw emotional stakes. Every gesture carries weight; every glance tells a story.
global.era: Imperial China, late Qing Dynasty period, approximately 1880s-1890s

characters.name: Mei
characters.description: The most valued jewel of the legendary brothel Lu Xian, groomed and taught the ways of intellect, seduction and pleasure, now facing the day of her purchase while secretly harboring love for a florist she has only watched from her terrace
characters.visual_appearance: Mei possesses the kind of beauty that stops hearts and starts wars—porcelain skin with the luminous quality of fine jade, unmarked and perfect from years of careful protection from sun and labor. Her face is an elegant oval with high cheekbones that catch light like carved stone. Her eyes are her most striking feature: large, dark pools of liquid amber-brown, framed by naturally curved lashes, capable of conveying innocence and knowing seduction in the same glance. Delicate brows arch like willow leaves above them. Her nose is small and straight, her lips full and naturally pink, trained in a thousand subtle expressions. Her hair is her crowning glory—a cascade of pure black silk that falls past her waist when unbound, usually arranged in elaborate styles held with jade pins and silk ribbons. Her neck is long and graceful, her shoulders slope elegantly, and her hands are small with tapered fingers, nails kept immaculate. Her figure is slender but curved, the result of dance training and careful diet. She moves with studied grace that has become second nature, each gesture a small performance.
characters.costume: Mei wears a powder blue silk kimono of exceptional quality—the blue soft as morning sky, the silk so fine it whispers with her movements. The garment is embroidered with subtle white orchid patterns along the hem and sleeves, visible only when light catches the thread. A darker blue obi sash cinches her waist, tied in an elaborate bow at her back. Beneath, layers of white and pale pink undergarments peek at collar and wrists. Her hair ribbon is deep crimson silk, a deliberate contrast to the cool blue, serving as both adornment and tool. Jade hairpins shaped like plum blossoms hold her elaborate hairstyle. Small gold earrings catch light at her ears. Her feet are bare in her private chambers, small and pale, though she owns embroidered silk slippers for formal occasions. She wears subtle makeup: powdered skin, rouged lips, kohled eyes—enhancing rather than masking her natural beauty.

physicality.baseline_posture: Perfect formal posture when observed—spine straight, shoulders back, chin slightly lowered in demure grace. When alone on her terrace watching Lin, she allows herself to lean forward, posture softening into genuine yearning.
physicality.gait: Trained to move like flowing water—small steps, hips swaying minimally, arms close to body. Each movement deliberate and graceful.
nervous_tells: Fingers finding the edge of her sleeve to smooth
Brief touches to her hair ribbon
A barely perceptible quickening of breath
Eyes dropping then rising through lashes
confident_tells: Sustained eye contact with a slight smile
Allowing her voice to drop to a lower register
Strategic deployment of her perfume through movement

arc.want: To buy her freedom and be with Lin
arc.need: To believe she deserves love freely given, not purchased or performed
arc.flaw: Has internalized her training so deeply she fears she cannot love authentically

characters.name: Min Zhu
characters.description: A grand merchant and notorious betting man, one of the two final suitors competing to purchase Mei
characters.visual_appearance: Min Zhu carries his wealth on his body—a thick-set man with a prosperous belly that strains against his fine robes, testament to decades of rich banquets and comfortable living. His face is round and fleshy, with small shrewd eyes that have calculated countless deals and measured innumerable risks. Deep lines bracket his mouth from a lifetime of smiling while negotiating. His skin is pale from spending his days in counting houses rather than fields, with age spots beginning to appear at his temples. His beard is carefully groomed, more gray than black now, trimmed to a point that he strokes when thinking. His hands are soft—merchant's hands that have never known labor—but his fingers are thick and strong from handling coins and account books. His eyebrows are bushy and expressive, often raised in calculation or lowered in concentration. Despite his bulk, he moves with surprising confidence, a man accustomed to rooms parting for his wealth. His teeth are yellowed from tea and tobacco. His ears are large, lobes stretched from heavy jade earrings he wore in his younger, more ostentatious days.
characters.costume: Min Zhu wears wealth like armor. His outer robe is rich burgundy silk brocade, heavy with gold thread embroidery depicting dragons chasing pearls—traditional symbols of power and fortune. The fabric alone costs more than most families earn in a year. Beneath, he wears layers of fine cotton and silk in cream and gold. His sash is thick black silk, holding a jade toggle carved into a prosperity symbol. Heavy jade rings adorn three fingers, and a gold chain at his neck suggests a hidden pocket watch—a Western affectation marking him as a man of international trade. His shoes are black silk with thick white soles, kept pristine by servants who carry him in a palanquin. A subtle fragrance of sandalwood and tobacco clings to his robes. His topknot is secured by a gold pin shaped like a coin, announcing his identity even in his hairstyle.

physicality.baseline_posture: Expansive—takes up space as a wealthy man's right. Legs spread when seated, arms often akimbo or gesturing broadly. Chin lifted.
physicality.gait: Measured and heavy, the walk of a man who never needs to hurry because others wait for him
nervous_tells: Eyes darting while face remains still
Fingers seeking his rings to twist
confident_tells: Belly laugh that shakes his entire frame
Leaning back with hands on knees
Prolonged eye contact with a knowing smirk

arc.want: To possess Mei as the ultimate status symbol and personal pleasure
arc.need: To learn that some things cannot be bought
arc.flaw: Believes everything has a price and his wealth makes him invincible

characters.name: Lin
characters.description: The florist who owns the shop on the corner beneath the brothel, who tends to his flowers with gentle touch and care, unknowingly the object of Mei's devoted observation and love
characters.visual_appearance: Lin possesses the kind of quiet handsomeness that reveals itself slowly—not striking at first glance but increasingly beautiful the longer one looks, much like the flowers he tends. His face is lean and angular, with high cheekbones and a strong jaw softened by a gentle expression. His skin is sun-touched from hours working among his plants, a warm bronze that speaks of honest outdoor labor. His eyes are kind, deep brown with golden flecks visible in sunlight, framed by straight brows and subtle laugh lines that suggest a man who finds joy in his work. His hair is thick and black, usually tied back simply with a cord while working, occasionally falling across his forehead when he bends to tend his flowers. His hands tell his story best: strong and calloused from work, soil perpetually embedded under his nails despite washing, yet capable of extraordinary gentleness when handling delicate blooms. He is lean but not thin, with the wiry strength of labor—shoulders broadened from carrying pots and soil, forearms corded with muscle. His posture is naturally good, spine straight from work that requires careful attention rather than brute force. A small scar crosses his right thumb from a childhood accident with pruning shears. His smile, rare but radiant, transforms his face completely.
characters.costume: Lin dresses simply and practically for his work. His tunic is faded indigo cotton, patched at one elbow, washed so many times it has become soft as silk. Simple brown cotton trousers, rolled at the ankle, show soil stains at the knees from kneeling. A worn leather apron with pockets holds his tools during work. His feet are often bare in the shop or clad in simple straw sandals for the street. In evenings, he removes the apron but rarely changes—the same humble tunic, perhaps a gray cotton jacket against chill. He wears no jewelry except a small jade pendant on a cord at his neck, barely visible—his mother's, kept close to his heart. His clothes carry the scent of earth and flowers, green growing things, life itself. Everything about his dress speaks of modest means and practical priorities—a man who spends his money on rare orchid bulbs rather than fine robes.

physicality.baseline_posture: Relaxed but attentive, like a plant turning toward sun—slight forward lean, hands often occupied with some task, weight easy on his feet
physicality.gait: Unhurried and deliberate, the pace of someone accustomed to the slow rhythm of growth
nervous_tells: Running his hand through his hair
Checking on a nearby plant as if for reassurance
Touching the jade pendant at his neck
confident_tells: Hands moving expressively while discussing flowers

arc.want: To live a simple life of beauty, tending his flowers
arc.need: To open himself to human love with the same devotion he shows his plants
arc.flaw: Has retreated from human connection into the safer world of flowers

characters.name: Madame Chou
characters.description: The formidable proprietress of the legendary brothel Lu Xian, a businesswoman of considerable acumen who has shaped Mei into her most valuable asset
characters.visual_appearance: Madame Chou wears her age as a queen wears her crown—not hidden but displayed as evidence of survival and success. Her face retains echoes of great beauty: strong bone structure, elegant brows, lips that know exactly how to curve for effect. But time has sharpened her features, thinning her cheeks, adding lines around eyes and mouth that speak of decades navigating the treacherous waters of the pleasure quarter. Her eyes are her most formidable feature: black and glittering, missing nothing, calculating everything. Her hair, now silver-streaked, is always impeccably arranged, lacquered into elaborate styles that add inches to her height. Her hands are manicured perfection, nails long and painted, though veins now show through papery skin. She is thin and straight-backed, refusing to bend to age, held together by will and whalebone. Her skin is pale and powdered, smoothing what cannot be hidden. Gold teeth flash when she smiles, replacements for those lost to time. She wears heavy perfume that announces her presence before she enters a room.
characters.costume: Madame Chou dresses in the severe elegance of a successful businesswoman. Her robes are always dark—black, deep purple, midnight blue—fine silk but never ostentatious. Gold embroidery in geometric patterns speaks of wealth without shouting it. Her obi is always tied perfectly, her layers immaculate. She favors heavy gold jewelry: earrings, rings, pins, a statement of assets accumulated through shrewd management. A ring of keys hangs at her sash, the jangle announcing her approach. Her shoes are elevated wooden geta, adding height and authority. Everything about her dress says: I am in charge here.

physicality.baseline_posture: Ramrod straight, shoulders back, chin lifted—the posture of absolute authority. Occupies space through stillness rather than expansion.
physicality.gait: Measured, deliberate, the wooden shoes creating a distinctive announcing rhythm
nervous_tells: Fingers seeking the keys at her waist
confident_tells: The faintest smile that never reaches her eyes

arc.want: To maximize profit from Mei's sale while maintaining the brothel's prestige
arc.need: None—she serves her narrative function as the system Mei must overcome
arc.flaw: Has reduced everything to transaction, including human worth

locations.name: Mei's Private Chamber at Lu Xian Brothel
locations.description: A gilded cage of extraordinary refinement, Mei's chamber is the finest room in Lu Xian. The space is dominated by a raised sleeping platform dressed in crimson silk bedding that pools like blood against dark mahogany. Fine bamboo mats cover the floor, worn soft from years of careful footsteps. A polished mahogany table sits at center, low to the ground, meant for formal tea service or, tonight, a fateful game. Painted screens depicting cranes and pines divide the space and filter light. Scrolls of calligraphy and landscape paintings adorn the walls. A bronze mirror on a stand allows Mei to prepare her careful masks. Cosmetics boxes of lacquered wood line one wall. Most importantly, latticed doors lead to a small private terrace—Mei's window to the world, her observation post over Lin's flower shop below. The room smells of sandalwood incense and orchid perfume. Every object speaks of wealth and taste, yet the bars on the windows and the locked door tell the true story.
locations.atmosphere: Opulent captivity. Beautiful as a jewel box, suffocating as a tomb. Every luxury reminds Mei of its price—that she is the ultimate luxury, kept perfect for purchase. The terrace alone offers freedom, a glimpse of the simple honest world below.
locations.lighting: During day, soft light filters through rice paper screens, flattering and diffused. At night, bronze oil lamps create pools of amber gold against shadows, everything warm and intimate. Candlelight flickers, painting the silk bedding in shifting oranges and reds. The terrace receives direct moonlight, a cooler palette against the warm interior.

sensory.visual: Crimson silk, mahogany gleam, rice paper glow, the geometric patterns of bamboo mats, the terrace doors framing the flower shop below
sensory.auditory: Distant music from other chambers, silk rustling, the clink of tea cups, the click of Go stones, Lin's faint humming rising from below
sensory.olfactory: Sandalwood incense, orchid perfume, rice powder cosmetics, the faint green scent of Lin's flowers drifting up from the terrace

locations.name: Mei's Private Terrace
locations.description: A small balcony of weathered wood jutting from Mei's chamber, barely large enough for one person to stand. Carved wooden railings have been worn smooth by Mei's hands as she leans to watch the world below. Potted orchids—white and purple—line the railing, a personal garden in this tiny space, mirroring Lin's domain below. The terrace directly overlooks Lin's flower shop, offering an unobstructed view of his daily work, his gentle ministrations, his humble life. For Mei, this is the most precious space in Lu Xian—her portal to possibility, her observatory of love. The wood is silvered with age, the railing at perfect height for leaning and dreaming. A small wooden stool allows longer vigils.
locations.atmosphere: Liminal space between imprisonment and freedom. Here Mei is neither courtesan nor customer's fantasy—she is simply a woman watching the man she loves. The air is different here: fresher, carrying the scent of flowers from below rather than the brothel's manufactured perfumes.
locations.lighting: Direct sun during day creates warm golden light, harsh compared to the diffused interior. At dusk, the light is pink and gold. At night, Lin's lantern glows below like a fallen star while moonlight silvers the terrace itself.

sensory.visual: The flower shop directly below, Lin's silhouette moving among blooms, potted orchids along the railing, the street beyond
sensory.auditory: Lin's humming, the snip of his shears, street sounds floating up, the creak of the old wooden floor
sensory.olfactory: Fresh flowers rising from below, night-blooming jasmine, clean air so different from the incensed interior

locations.name: Lin's Flower Shop
locations.description: A humble storefront occupying the corner beneath Lu Xian, Lin's shop is a riot of controlled beauty. The space is small but overflowing: terracotta pots of orchids in impossible purples and whites, buckets of chrysanthemums, bamboo trellises supporting climbing jasmine. A worn wooden workbench dominates one corner, scarred by years of trimming and arranging, covered with small scissors, copper wire, earthen dishes of water for cuttings. Shelves line every wall, each holding blooming miracles. The ceiling is low, strung with drying flowers hung upside down. In the back, a simple living space: a low table where Lin takes his meals, a rolled sleeping mat, a small shrine to his ancestors. One window faces the street; through the open front, the shop spills onto the sidewalk with more displays. Everything is aged but cared for, modest but beautiful. This is a kingdom of growing things, ruled by a gentle king.
locations.atmosphere: Humble sanctuary of life and growth. The opposite of the brothel's manufactured beauty—here everything is natural, patient, real. The space feels like a held breath, like the moment before a bud opens. Peace radiates from every surface.
locations.lighting: Natural daylight through the open front, shifting with clouds. In evening, a single paper lantern at Lin's table creates a warm golden circle against encroaching shadow. The effect is intimate, holy, like a candle in a church.

sensory.visual: Explosion of flower colors—purple orchids, white chrysanthemums, pink peonies—against weathered wood and terracotta. Lin's silhouette against the lantern glow.
sensory.auditory: Street sounds filtering in, the snip of shears, water being poured, Lin humming softly as he works, the rustle of leaves
sensory.olfactory: Overwhelming flower perfume, green growing things, damp earth, the honest smell of a man who works with his hands

locations.name: The Corner Street
locations.description: A pressed dirt road worn smooth by generations of feet, carts, and palanquins. The corner where Lin's shop meets the world is a crossroads of lives—merchants heading to market, servants running errands, sedan chairs carrying nobles. Lu Xian's gilded entrance lies further down, marked by red lanterns even in daylight. Lin's shop occupies the humble corner, flowers spilling onto the street, a patch of color and life against dusty earth. The buildings are close, creating a sense of intimacy. At night, paper lanterns light pools along the way. The distance from Lu Xian's door to Lin's shop is perhaps thirty paces—an eternity for one in captivity, a sprint for one finally free.
locations.atmosphere: The liminal space between worlds—the opulent prison of Lu Xian and the humble freedom of Lin's shop. By day, busy with ordinary commerce. By night, shadowed and significant, the road of Mei's final journey.
locations.lighting: Harsh daylight on the dirt road, softened where shop awnings provide shade. At night, pools of warm lantern glow alternate with deep shadow. Moonlight silvers the dust.

sensory.visual: Pressed dirt road, flower shop corner with blooms spilling out, red lanterns of Lu Xian in the distance, varied pedestrians
sensory.auditory: Cart wheels on packed earth, vendor calls, conversation, the everyday symphony of commerce
sensory.olfactory: Dust, street food from nearby stalls, the floral oasis of Lin's shop corner

locations.name: Lu Xian Main Hall
locations.description: The legendary reception hall of Lu Xian brothel, a space designed to intoxicate before any service is rendered. The room soars with carved wooden beams painted in red and gold. Silk lanterns hang like captive moons, casting everything in flattering amber glow. Low tables of polished mahogany are arranged for intimate parties, each surrounded by brocade cushions. A raised platform for musicians occupies one end, instruments gleaming. Screens painted with erotic scenes in subtle suggestion line the walls. The floor is covered in carpets imported from Persia, their patterns complex as the transactions made above them. Incense burns perpetually, a thick sweet fog. This is where deals are struck, where wealth meets beauty, where Mei's fate was negotiated between Madame Chou and her suitors.
locations.atmosphere: Intoxicating, deliberately overwhelming—designed to blur judgment and loosen purse strings. Every surface invites touch; every shadow promises pleasure. The room is a seduction in architecture.
locations.lighting: Silk lanterns create permanent amber dusk, concealing flaws and enhancing beauty. No harsh light is permitted. Shadows are soft and suggestive.

sensory.visual: Red and gold dominate—silk lanterns, brocade cushions, lacquered wood, the gleam of instruments, painted screens
sensory.auditory: Soft music, tinkling laughter, clinking cups, the rustle of expensive fabric
sensory.olfactory: Heavy incense, rice wine, expensive perfumes, the undertone of opium from back rooms

props.name: Wooden Go Board with Stones
props.appearance: A rectangular board of aged mahogany, its surface grid of nineteen lines burned into the wood with practiced precision. The wood has darkened with age and oil from countless hands, surface worn smooth at the corners. Two wooden bowls sit beside it: one holding polished white clamshell stones, the other containing slate-black stones worn smooth with play. Each stone is lens-shaped, satisfying to hold, cool to the touch. The board shows its history in every nick and stain—a veteran of countless battles of wit.
props.significance: The battlefield where Mei wagers her future. The black and white stones represent the binary nature of her gamble—freedom or bondage, love or captivity. The game is traditional, ruled, structured; Mei will win by stepping outside those rules entirely.

props.name: Mei's Crimson Silk Hair Ribbon
props.appearance: A long strip of deep crimson silk, the red of arterial blood, of luck, of passion. The silk is so fine it floats when released, catching air like a living thing. The edges are finished with tiny stitches, the ends weighted slightly to make it hang properly. It has held Mei's hair through countless performances, absorbed her perfume, become part of her identity. When untied, it falls in a rippling cascade, releasing both hair and scent.
props.significance: Mei's weapon of last resort. The ribbon is her training made tangible—beauty and seduction weaponized for survival. Its release marks the moment she deploys everything she knows to win not a man's heart, but her own freedom. The crimson stands out against her blue kimono, a controlled accent of passion.

props.name: Mei's Letter to Lin
props.appearance: A single sheet of fine rice paper, folded small and sealed with plain wax. The paper is thin enough to see shadows through when held to light. Inside, Mei's careful brushwork—elegant but not ostentatious, trained calligraphy conveying genuine emotion. The ink is quality black, the characters precise. The paper carries the faint scent of orchid perfume. The letter itself is a vulnerability made physical, her heart's truth committed to fragile paper.
props.significance: Mei's declaration of impossible love, sent before she knows whether she'll win her freedom. The letter represents faith—in her plan, in Lin's goodness, in the possibility of a different life. It is the bravest thing she's ever done, more than the wager itself, because it is not strategy but truth.

props.name: Lin's Paper Lantern
props.appearance: A simple paper lantern of the common type—bamboo frame, rice paper panels, a candle within. The paper is yellowed with smoke, one panel patched where flame came too close. The frame shows years of handling, the wood darkened by Lin's touch. The light it casts is warm and uneven, flickering with any breath of air. This is no luxury item but a working man's light, humble and honest as its owner.
props.significance: The beacon Mei watches from her terrace, marking Lin's presence in the evening hours. When she finally crosses to his door, this light guides her. It represents his simple, steady nature—modest but warm, humble but reliable. The lantern is home.

props.name: Porcelain Tea Cup
props.appearance: A small handleless cup of fine white porcelain, thin enough to see finger shadows through when filled. A delicate blue pattern of orchids circles the rim—a particularly pointed choice for this game. The cup is from a set used to serve important guests, expensive but not showy. Steam rises from properly brewed jasmine tea, the scent carrying Mei's strategy through the air. The cup is small in her hand, elegant, part of her arsenal.
props.significance: The vehicle for Mei's distraction—legitimate service covering strategic deployment. By pouring tea, she can move within the merchant's space without breaking propriety. The orchid pattern connects to Lin's world, a private reminder of what she's fighting for.

props.name: Mei's Savings Pouch
props.appearance: A small cloth pouch of undyed cotton, worn soft from years of handling, tied with a simple cord. Inside, coins of various denominations—silver taels and copper cash—accumulated slowly over years of tips from dancing and hosting. The weight is modest but significant, representing thousands of small transactions, favors and performances, flirtatious smiles and poured drinks. The pouch is hidden in her sleeve until needed, secret and precious.
props.significance: Mei's accumulated agency—proof that even in captivity, she has been planning. This money represents her only negotiating power, the stake that makes the wager possible. It's not enough to buy her freedom outright, but combined with wit and seduction, it might be enough.

props.name: White Orchid
props.appearance: A perfect stem of white Phalaenopsis orchid, five blooms open in graduated sizes, each flower like a face turning toward light. The petals are waxy white with faint yellow centers, impossibly delicate. The stem is strong and green, supported by a thin bamboo stake. The pot is simple terracotta, the soil dark and rich. This orchid sits on Mei's terrace railing, tended with stolen techniques observed from watching Lin—her secret practice of his craft, her tribute to his teachings.
props.significance: The bridge between Mei and Lin's worlds. She tends this orchid with everything she's learned from watching him, her love expressed in cultivation. It represents what she wants: to be cared for as Lin cares for his flowers, to be nurtured rather than possessed, to bloom rather than be bought.
